subject: p13078497
Impression: AP chest compared to through, 1:18 pm: Severe bilateral infiltrative pulmonary abnormality continues to worsen. Small bilateral pleural effusions and moderate cardiomegaly suggest that at least some of this abnormality is due to pulmonary edema, but the widespread recurrent infiltrative pulmonary abnormality present to varying degrees on chest CT scans since suggests an underlying process such as chronic pulmonary drug toxicity. ET tube is in standard placement. Swan-Ganz catheter ends in the right pulmonary artery. No pneumothorax.
